raw_mentions:
Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:


The external solution is standard Tyrodes solution containing 130 NaCl, 4 KCl, 1.8 CaCl<sub>2</sub>, 1.0 MgCl<sub>2</sub>, 20 HEPES, 10 glucose, pH 7.35 and compounds are prepared as 10-20mM DMSO stocks and diluted to appropriate test concentrations with IC50 values generated.
Calcium influx, expressed as % control, is calculated for each concentration of test compound and concentration-response curves and IC50 values are generated using GraphPad Prism 4.0.
Inhibition was measured at the end of the 1 second pulses and expressed relative to controls with an initial KvI.5 inhibition estimated by single point determinations done at 1μM.
Curve fitting and IC<sub>50</sub> estimating are done using Graphpad software (Ver. 4) with concentration response curves generated for appropriate compounds utilizing at least four concentrations and an n = 3.
